channel.title: Make chat text from regular players gray, mods blue and owner red? [317]
channel.description:
How would i go about making the chat text IN THE CHATBOX a different color depending on the player rights?
EX; the owner says "Welcome, everyone!" and the Mod says "Hey, Brennan:)" I wondered if it could look like this (owner is Brennan, mod is Joe) "Brennan: Welcome, everyone!" "Joe: Hey, Brennan:)"
Sorry if this is client sided, to be honest I don't know which category this fits into :\
I'm using a 317!

item.title: Make chat text from regular players gray, mods blue and owner red? [317]
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

Well, make a backup of your client, and mess around with some of them. I really don’t know how this can be done by loading the character rights, for each person.

Read full topic
item.source: Make chat text from regular players gray, mods blue and owner red? [317]

item.title: Make chat text from regular players gray, mods blue and owner red? [317]
item.dc:creator: @PushedPrawn PushedPrawn
item.description:
@PushedPrawn wrote:

GrimReapersScythe:

Alright, Well it would be in client.java, or gui, depending if your jframe has the chat effects menu, or if its loaded in gui. First search both files for something along the lines of: “setchat” or “setcolour”.

in CLIENT.JAVA of my CLIENT files I found a lot of the setcolor’s, about 6 I think.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @PushedPrawn PushedPrawn
item.description:
@PushedPrawn wrote:

GrimReapersScythe:

Look into the methods where it’s loading the crowns for each player, and try adding a setchat option there. I’m really not sure, but this is worth a shot.

Uh… With that two problems you may be able to help me with:

  1. What do i search? (Assuming it’s in client.java)
  2. What would the code generally look like for this “setchat” option? I’ve never looked at one.

Answering that i should be able to figure it out.
